metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22016 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in FFmpeg 4.2 at libavcodec/get_bits.h when writing .mov files, which might lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libav-tools - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2').
